name: Europeesk Buro foar Lytse Talen
membership: EBLT is a member of the Network to Promote Linguistic Diversity (NPLD), www.npld.eu
goal:
The goal of EBLT is to safeguard, protect and promote all minority languages spoken in de Kingdom of the Netherlands. At present EBLT represents the following language communities: Frisian, Bildts, Low Saxon (Nedersaksisch), Papiamentu and Limburgish.

In order to that EBLT also collaborates with minority language communities in other member states of the EU and their networks, such as FUEN and NPLD.
interests: Audiovisual and Media, Communication, Culture, Education, Information Society, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Trans-European Networks
euInitiatives: Multilingualism, culture, education (including lifelong learning), Intergroup Minorities, European Capitals of Culture, European Civil Initiatives.
